intro: Veronicastrum sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian blazingstar, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is commonly found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats.
